alert.note: Alert for Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 4:18AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cook County through 445 AM CDT... At 418 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles northeast of Eagle Mountain, or 20 miles east of Gunflint Lake, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Cook County, including the following locations... Tom Lake, Clearwater Lake, Swamp Lake, Bearskin Lake, North Fowl Lake, Pine Lake, Watab Lake, Judge Magney State Park and Grand Portage Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore
